tools.name: xml_format
tools.description: Parse XML-style function calls and convert to OpenAI JSON format

metadata.use_case: Model outputs XML instead of JSON tool calls

metadata.description: Registry of all available tools and compatibility layers for the LLM Framework
metadata.note: This file tracks which tool features are available and their enabled/disabled status. Tools can be postprocessors (modify LLM output) or llm_invokable (functions the LLM can call).

configuration_notes.enabled: Tool activation state: false (disabled), 'auto' (load at init, use when needed), true (actively enabled/forced)
configuration_notes.type: Type of tool: 'postprocessor' (modifies LLM output), 'preprocessor' (modifies input), 'llm_invokable' (LLM can call as function)
configuration_notes.directory: Directory path where tool implementation is stored (relative to tools/)
configuration_notes.metadata.supported_states: Array of enabled states this tool supports (e.g., ['false', 'auto'] or ['false', 'auto', 'true'])
configuration_notes.metadata.permissions: For llm_invokable tools: whitelist, rate limits, size limits, etc.
configuration_notes.global_config.require_approval: If true, prompt user before executing sensitive operations
configuration_notes.global_config.sensitive_operations: List of operation types that require approval when require_approval is true

tool_types.postprocessor: Modifies LLM output after generation (e.g., XML format converter)
tool_types.preprocessor: Modifies input before sending to LLM (future use)
tool_types.llm_invokable: Functions the LLM can actively call (e.g., web search, file access, command execution)

usage_instructions.enabling_tool: Set enabled to: false (disabled), 'auto' (recommended - loads at init), or true (force active)
usage_instructions.managing_tools: Use 'llf tool' commands to list, enable, disable, auto, and view tool info
usage_instructions.managing_config: Use 'llf tool config' commands to manage global tool configuration
usage_instructions.creating_tool: Add new tool definitions to the 'tools' array following the appropriate type template

changes: v1.1: Added type distinction (postprocessor vs llm_invokable), added global_config for approval prompts
v1.0: Initial schema migrated from tools_config.json
